title: [Large-Scale] Microlearning Based on Allosteric Repulsion Learning Model for Enhancing Chemical Achievement and Lateral Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational chemistry concepts and problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Personalized content delivery via individual mobile devices, with microlearning sessions (15 minutes) conducted 2-3 times per week

learning_goals: Can accurately solve chemical concept application problems with over 80% accuracy.
Improve the ability to conduct multidimensional analysis of chemical phenomena by applying creative thinking techniques.
Develop systematic strategies to approach complex chemical problems through the allosteric repulsion learning model.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
